submission:
class Solution:
    def countOfPairs(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        if len(nums) == 1:
            return nums[0]+1
        max_num = max(nums)
        valid_nums_1 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]
        valid_nums_2 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]

        for i in range(nums[-1]+1):
            valid_nums_1[i] += 1
            valid_nums_2[i] += 1

        for i in list(range(len(nums)-1))[::-1]:
            # print(valid_nums_1)
            # print(valid_nums_2)
            # print('-----')
            next_v1 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]
            next_v2 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]
            suffix_sum_1 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]
            cur_sum = 0
            for j in list(range(len(valid_nums_1)))[::-1]:
                cur_sum += valid_nums_1[j]
                suffix_sum_1[j] = cur_sum
            prefix_sum_2 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]
            cur_sum = 0
            for j in range(len(valid_nums_2)):
                cur_sum += valid_nums_2[j]
                prefix_sum_2[j] = cur_sum



            for val in range(nums[i]+1):
                possible_suffixes_1 = suffix_sum_1[val]
                val_2 = nums[i]-val
                possible_suffixes_2 = prefix_sum_2[val_2]
                next_v1[val] = min(possible_suffixes_1, possible_suffixes_2)
                next_v2[val_2] = min(possible_suffixes_1, possible_suffixes_2)
            valid_nums_1 = next_v1
            valid_nums_2 = next_v2
        
        return (sum(valid_nums_1)) % (10**9+7)
